conclusion: Introduction to solving work done by gas from state C to state D
Understanding the cyclic process in the p-V diagram
Vertical axis shows pressure in units of 10⁵ Pa
Horizontal axis shows volume in terms of V/L
State C is at position (4, 0.75×10⁵ Pa)
State D is at position (3, 0.75×10⁵ Pa)
Work done by a gas in a thermodynamic process is calculated using integral of pressure over volume change
Process C→D is an isobaric process at p = 0.75×10⁵ Pa
Volume changes from V_C = 4L to V_D = 3L
For constant pressure, work formula simplifies to W = p(V_2 - V_1)
Negative sign indicates work is done ON the gas, not BY the gas
Work done BY the gas is -W = 0.75 × 10^5 J = 75,000 J
Verification of conventions: Work done BY the gas is positive when expanding, ON the gas is positive when compressed
Since gas is compressed from V = 4L to V = 3L, work is done ON the gas
Final answer: Work done externally BY the gas from C to D is -75,000 J or -75 kJ
Negative sign indicates surroundings do work on the gas during compression
